intro: Malvastrum bolivianum, commonly known as the Bolivian mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain regions.
